text.0: thou bearer of oblations though kindled art kindled for the gods.
text.1: with the Ādityas rudras vasus come to us to show us favour come to us.
text.2: come hither and accept with joy this sacrifice and hymn of ours.
text.3: o kindled god we mortals are invoking thee calling on thee to show us grace.
text.4: i laud thee jātavedas thee lord of all blessings with my song.
text.5: agni bring hitherward the gods whose laws we love whose laws we love to show us grace.
text.6: agni the god was made the great highpriest of gods Ṛṣis have kindled agni men of mortal mould.
text.7: agni i invocate for winning ample wealth kindly disposed for winning wealth.
text.8: atri and bharadvāja and gavisthira kaṇva and trasadasyu in our fight he helped.
text.9: on agni calls vasiṣṭha even the household priest the household priest to win his grace.
